security_audit.title: SECURITY AUDIT REPORT
security_audit.cert_renewal_desc: To renew or import a machine certificate into the Personal store:
security_audit.ksp_desc: Use KSP (Key Storage Provider) for maximum security & WPA3 compatibility.
security_audit.csp_desc: Use CSP (Legacy) only if required by very old client devices.
security_audit.ntauth_missing: If a CA is missing from NTAuth store (needed for RADIUS Trust):
security_audit.managed_by_windows: Managed by Windows Defaults (No GPO override detected)
security_audit.resolution_hint_text: Run: certutil -dspublish -f 'cert.cer' NTAuthCA (AD) or certutil -addstore -f NTAuth 'cert.cer' (Local)

vulns.ssl3_desc: SSL 3.0 is vulnerable to POODLE attack. Disable immediately.
vulns.tls10_desc: TLS 1.0 is deprecated and vulnerable to BEAST, CRIME attacks. PCI DSS requires TLS 1.2+.
vulns.tls11_desc: TLS 1.1 is deprecated since 2020. Modern browsers no longer support it.
vulns.no_modern_tls_desc: Neither TLS 1.2 nor TLS 1.3 is enabled. Server cannot establish secure connections.
vulns.weak_ciphers_desc: Weak/insecure ciphers enabled: %{ciphers}. Remove from configuration.
vulns.expired_cert_desc: Certificate expired on %{date}. Clients will reject connections.
vulns.self_signed_desc: Self-signed certificates are not trusted by browsers. Use CA-signed certificates in production.
vulns.ntauth_missing_desc: The following CAs are not in NTAuthStore: %{ca_list}. This may cause RADIUS authentication failures.
vulns.ntauth_missing_rec_ad: Add missing CAs to NTAuth store via AD: certutil -dspublish -f 'cert_file.cer' NTAuthCA
vulns.ntauth_missing_rec_local: Add missing CAs to local NTAuth store: certutil -addstore -f NTAuth 'cert_file.cer'
vulns.maintenance_cert_desc: The certificate audit failed: %{error}. This requires code maintenance (API check).
vulns.maintenance_access_denied_desc: %{error_desc} (Code 5). Hidden stores: %{stores}. Check current user permissions.
vulns.maintenance_access_denied_admin_desc: %{error_desc} (Code 5). Access denied to stores %{stores} even in Read-Only mode. Check your GPO or security software.

win_errors.err_2: System cannot find the file specified (Missing Store)
win_errors.err_3: The system cannot find the path specified
win_errors.err_5: Access Denied (Insufficient Permissions - Run as Admin)
win_errors.err_8: Not enough storage is available to process this command
win_errors.err_14: Not enough storage is available to complete this operation
win_errors.err_32: The process cannot access the file because it is being used by another process
win_errors.err_0x80092004: Object or property cannot be found (Store might not exist)
win_errors.err_0x8009000B: Key state is invalid for the operation
win_errors.err_0x80092003: An error occurred while accessing a cryptographic data structure
win_errors.err_0x800B0109: A certificate chain processed, but terminated in a root certificate which is not trusted by the trust provider
win_errors.err_0x80092026: The certificate already exists in the store

vulns.maintenance_reg_desc: The registry audit module failed: %{error}. Code maintenance needed.
vulns.maintenance_log_desc: Failed to read System Event Logs: %{error}. Code maintenance needed.
vulns.log_error_msg: ERROR: Could not read System Event Logs (Maintenance required): %{error}
vulns.no_issues_rec: ✅ No security issues or Schannel errors detected.
vulns.events_detected_rec: ℹ️ Schannel events detected but no vulnerabilities found.
